Title: The Ultimate Brand Challenge: Digital Marketing
Description: are you ready to unleash your marketing genius and compete in the digital marketing hackathon the ultimate brand challenge gather your team pick your track and get ready to create campaigns that could change the game date oct 26 2024venue cambridge international schoolparticipants students in teams of 3 to 5 membersobjective teams will create a comprehensive digital marketing strategy for a hypothetical brand focusing on specific smart goals and proposing campaign ideas event timeline 900 am welcome introduction to the hackathonkickoff with a brief overview of the event introduction of tracks and an outline of the days schedule 930 am performance by the host schoola brief keynote address on current trends and future directions in digital marketing 945 am keynote the future of digital marketinga brief keynote address on current trends and future directions in digital marketing 1000 am workshop from clicks to clientsa 1hour workshop focusing on converting website traffic into actual clients through effective strategies and techniques 1100 am track briefing team strategy sessionsteams have 2 hours to perfect their presentations and design landing pages incorporating insights from the workshop 100 pm lunch breaka break for participants to recharge 130 pm final presentations to judges teams present their digital marketing strategies and campaign ideas to a panel of judges a time of 3 minutes will be given to each team with 1 minute of questioning round 330 pm awards ceremony closing remarksawards are presented for outstanding strategies creativity and individual performances closing remarks to conclude the event
Requirements:
Requirements
        
        
      

      
        What to Build
Event Tracks: Industry-Specific D2C Businesses
Teams can choose any one track to participate.
1. Apparel & Fashion
A D2C loungewear brand for women in premium yet affordable category, focusing on comfort and trendy designs.
Objective: To increase sales revenue.
2. Health & Wellness
A D2C brand selling all-natural supplements and vitamins.
Objective: Increase website traffic by leveraging social content about healthy living.
3. Beauty & Skincare
A vegan, cruelty-free skincare brand emphasizing clean ingredients and sustainability.
Objective: Improve customer loyalty through personalized engagement and rewards. 
4. Tech & Gadgets
A D2C startup selling ergonomic tech accessories aimed at improving productivity and comfort.
Objective: Launch a new product and create buzz to drive initial sales.
5. Food & Beverage
A Pan-Asian restaurant targeting tourists in a Tier-II city with a unique dining experience.
Objective: Increase brand awareness among tourists visiting the city.
6. Parenting & Career Consultation
A parenting and career consultation coach offering personalized advice and resources for parents and professionals.
Objective: Increase business leads by promoting tailored consultations and valuable resources through digital channels.
ÃÂ 
ÃÂ 
ÃÂ 
Key Activities to be performed by the Teams
Each team will be required to address the following key areas in their digital marketing strategy presentation:
1. Competitor Analysis
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Identify key competitors in the chosen sector.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Analyze competitors' strengths, weaknesses, market positioning, and customer engagement strategies.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Highlight gaps in the market that the brand can leverage.
2. SWOT Analysis
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Perform a SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats) for the brand, focusing on internal factors (strengths/weaknesses) and external market conditions (opportunities/threats).
3. Target Audience Identification
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Define the target audience for the brand.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Create customer personas based on demographics, behavior, pain points, and motivations.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Identify key platforms and channels where the target audience is most active.
4. Marketing Strategy (with Timelines)
Teams must develop a detailed marketing strategy, covering the following areas:
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Social Media Content Plan: Outline a social media calendar, including types of content (posts, stories, videos) and engagement tactics.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Paid Media Strategy: Create campaigns using Google Ads, Facebook, Instagram, etc., with a focus on conversions and brand awareness.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Email Marketing & Retargeting: Plan email sequences for lead nurturing, customer retention, and cart abandonment.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Influencer or Partnership Marketing: Propose collaborations or partnerships with influencers or complementary brands to boost visibility.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  WhatsApp/Referral Campaigns: Design campaigns for customer engagement through WhatsApp or referral programs to incentivize existing customers to bring in new ones.
5. SMART Goals and Metrics (OPTIONAL)
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Prepare a 30-day content calendar for social media (Use of Generative AI tools is allowed)
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals for the marketing strategy.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Include clear timelines and milestones for executing each aspect of the marketing plan.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Propose key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the success of the campaigns, such as:
oÃÂ ÃÂ  Increase in website traffic
oÃÂ ÃÂ  Number of new leads generated
oÃÂ ÃÂ  Social media engagement rates
oÃÂ ÃÂ  Conversion rates
oÃÂ ÃÂ  Customer acquisition cost (CAC) 
Note: Any team that attempts to prepare slides on this section will be given bonus points.
ÃÂ 
6. Presentation & Pitch
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Teams will have to present their entire marketing strategy, walk judges through their analysis, and pitch their final recommendations in a time of 4 minutes.
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  The presentation should be clear, concise, and persuasive, focusing on how the proposed strategy meets the brand's objectives.
ÃÂ

        1.	Understanding of the Industry

Title: ETHSF Hackathon 2025
Description: ethsf hackathon 2025the ethsf hackathon is a weeklong building sprint in the ultimate builder hub san francisco this is where builders developers and creatives come together to decentralize tech and unite the future of innovation events schedule march 10  opening ceremony  kickoff kick off ethsf with key insights sponsor and mentor meetups and the first look at this years problem statements the opening sets the stage for a highimpact week ahead inviteonly register here march 10 to 14  official ethsf coworking  hackathon venue a dedicated coworking space at the celo office for ethsf hackers offering free daily lunch an onsite barista and networking opportunities register here and join their telegram channel to learn more march 15  hackathon judging online on march 15 both the main track and sponsor track judging sessions will be conducted online our panel of expert judges will evaluate all main track projects and select the top projects based on creativity realworld impact execution and presentation concurrently sponsor track entries will be reviewed to award prizes to the standout projects march 16  demo day  closing ceremony this is where everything comes to life teams will showcase their projects to the ethsf community judges and sponsors youll get to explore gamechanging ideas meet the builders and celebrate the hard work that went into them prizes total prize pool 6 eth 1 eth award each awarded to the top three projects 3 eth award for quadratic voting qv the ethsf community decides who gets a share track eligibility guidelines main track the top teams that are shortlisted after project submission must be present inperson on the demo day to be eligible for the top 3 awards the demo day venue in san francisco will be disclosed to the finalists prior to the event sponsor tracks build from sf or anywhere worldwide with no requirement to be physically present at the hackathon venue note the judges and organizers will only consider your devfolio project submission before shortlisting the top teams and finalists for main and sponsor tracks please make sure your project submission is as complete as possible with demo videos high quality screenshots and wellwritten descriptions and problem statements why ethsf nestled between ethdenver and industrydefining events like nvidias gtc and gdc the ethsf hackathon bridges the blockchain ai and gaming worlds gain insights from leading voices in the ethereum community get mentorship from ethereum leaders access to technical workshops and crosspollination opportunities from nearby conferences demo your hacks to industry experts with prizes funding opportunities and ecosystem support for standout teams enjoy an intimate setting that fosters creative collaboration far from crowded conference halls beyond the hackathon explore other events happening during the ethsf week including community day at stanford the stanford blockchain ai summit and dacc day at uc berkeley learn more and register here httpswwwethereumsforg build learn and launch in ethereums most dynamic week on the west coastrulesfollow the code of conductfind us onimg alttwitter Title: Solvex25
Description: punes biggest hackathonsolvex  the 24hour innovation challenge an initiative under solutions 2k25 innovation problemsolving and collaboration take center stage at solvex a 24hour offline innovation challenge conducted under solutions 2k25 the annual technical fest of army institute of technology ait pune this flagship event provides a platform for aspiring innovators developers and problem solvers to tackle realworld challenges through technologydriven solutions event format  selection process solvex is structured into two key phases preliminary screening  online idea pitching round last date march 16th 2025 the challenge problem statement is attached teams will submit a detailed proposal outlining their idea technical approach and impact potential submissions will be reviewed based on feasibility innovation and scalability the list of finalists top 12 teams will be uploaded on march 18th 2025 the selected teams will be invited to the final round at ait pune final round  24hour hackathon april 5th  6th 2025  1000 am onwards the top 12 selected teams will participate in a nonstop 24hour innovation sprint where they will build a working prototype of their solution at the end of 24 hours each team will present their solution to a panel of judges followed by a qa session how to participate step 1 register your team step 2 submit midsubmission report deadline march 16th 2025 share a brief proposal of your project including problem statement approach  methodology tech stack  tools used step 3 final submission for finalists upload the following github repository with welldocumented code youtube video 35 min explaining overview of the project key features and functionality workflow explanation a live demo is not necessary but teams should clearly explain how their solution would function our panel of judges will evaluate projects based on innovation  originality and uniqueness of the idea impact  practical benefits and realworld applications feasibility  how achievable and scalable the solution is execution  code quality performance and completeness prizes  industry support with a total prize pool of 15 lakhs solvex
